fields.description:
I get an error when I import my snipsnap database.  The error is as follows:

CONFLUENCE 
System Error 
A system error has occurred. 

If this problem persists - please notify your Confluence administrator of this problem. 

If you experience problems getting to this support page, please send an email to confluence-support@atlassian.com with the following information: 

a description of your problem 
cut & paste the error and system information found below 
attach the application server log file

fields.summary: Pages that have more than one version have different icon

fields.description:
Currently the user profile UI looks half done (it is ;)). 
- the list of recent pages can be compacted into one column I think 
- perhaps the user's personal profile should have a grey box around it (like the space description)
- if you're looking at your own profile, it might also be nice to have some help text displayed like "this is your personal profile page, you can edit it just like any other Confluence page. Edit it now." or something
- we need to work out a better way of displaying the username, email, fullname and groups. I suggest putting groups on the RHS (as they're only viewable to yourself anyway) and the rest into the surtitle in a nice compact format.
fields.summary: Improve user profile UI

fields.description:
The UI of the user browser is not very good at the moment. I think we can clean it up a lot.
- the number of users is currently listed twice
- the filter form can be compacted a lot (the title is not needed - perhaps we can make it into a single sentence like in our CRM system)
- the columnar layout of users is also probably not the best use of space, I'm sure we can improve it
- the add new user link should probably be more prominent too, as should the show deactivated users flag (perhaps this can be part of the filter?)
fields.summary: Fix user browser UI
[~username] link fails when username contains @

fields.description:
Is there a way to escape links, inline?
I'd like to have use psuedo links (examples that don't go to actual pages) in documents.

right now the only way to do this is a noformat macro.

I'd just like to say 
\http://site/app/donwload
fields.summary: Way to escape links

fields.description:
If a page contains an anchor (using the {anchor} macro) and also contains a link to that anchor (using the [#foo] syntax), the link is listed as an incoming link to the page (i.e. the page itself is listed as an entry in the "Incoming Links" list).  While it is a link it isn't really an incoming link.  Nor is it of any interest.

If the source of a link to a page is within the page itself the link shouldn't be classed as an incoming link.
fields.summary: anchor links to local page anchors classed as incoming link

Moving a page from Space A to Space B

1) Move page from A to B
2) Page does not appear as a child page of the page "Home"
3) Manually attempt to set the page's parent as "Home" failes
4) Attempt to move the page back to A from B, A doesn't appear in the space list
5) Delete page
6) Re-create page in Space A
7) After page is created you get the following:

The following error(s) occurred:
The page specified does not exist.

Enable comments inside pages, not just at the end of a page

fields.summary: add title parameter to links ( hrefs )

fields.description:
try this and see :
http://confluence.atlassian.com:8080/display/DISC/Confluence%2BXML-RPC%2BAPI%2BSpec

we put :
* [Introduction|Confluence XML-RPC API Spec#introduction]

we expect to see on the page: 'Introduction'
we get : 'Introduction#introduction'
fields.summary: Page anchors showing in links

fields.description:
There is an RSS feed which informs me when a page in a space is updated.  It tells me *which* page was updated, but not by *whom*, *when*, or *what*.

Here I think especially *what* was changed is interesting.  Therefore I'd suggest that the feed item descriptions should be the accumulated diff since the previous revision published through the feed.  This is how it works with JSPWiki.  Also that would make the feed much smaller in size.  Currently it's over 40KB.
fields.summary: provide page diffs in rss feed

fields.description:
The Confluence instance wide RSS feed seems to accumulate all kinds of changes (including added pages and updated pages) for all spaces, whereas the per space feeds have 3 individual feeds which categorize the changes into "added pages", "updated pages", and "commented pages".

Personally I'd like a feed per space which aggregates all these 3 types of updates.  With a feed like that I wouldn't use the three others at all.  But I have no idea how others feel about this, so I can't tell whether the three space feeds should be replaced by a single one or if it should just be an additional feed.
fields.summary: consolidate rss feeds of space

fields.description:
I can't have Confluence sent notification emails locally. Although I've configured a valid SMTP server and could sent the TEST email successfully... I'm using a firewall here so easily can catch whenever a piece of software is trying to send any email. But no attempt is done by Confluence on the specific events we've configured (edit/create page/space, add comment, attach file).

NOTE: The user account has a valid email and is configured to receive notifications by email.
fields.summary: No notification email is sent!

fields.description: We need i18n support when an action isn't available.  The only example I have now is in Quartz job executions.
fields.summary: I18n for execution threads that aren't triggered by web requests

fields.description: listpages.action should show a page count - This is a small improvement so that a user can easily determine how many documents in a space. This would have been usedful during our migration where we moved over several hundred documents into confluence.
fields.summary: listpages.action should show a page count

fields.description: I would like to add my own header/footer to exported documents. When exporting a space, I want this to have a nicer title than "Space Details"
fields.summary: Changing header/footer of exported PDF document

fields.description: I couldnt seem to find an option to delete a space
fields.summary: Is there a way to delete a space?

fields.description: I tried creating templates and when using them the resulting page is always blank and the template doesnt seem to be used at all.
fields.summary: Templates feature doesnt seem to work in B3

fields.description: When exporting a space with amny pages it would be nice to list all the pages in the hierarchy, rather than a list, with shortcuts to select/de-select all, and when I select a parent node, to have all the child nodes auto-select as well
fields.summary: User friendly options for exporting a space

fields.description: I am creating a space to use for creating documentation, so I am very interested in the exported PDF. When creating the space, I would like to be able to re-order the child pages so that the {children:all=true} macro returns them in the correct order and the generated PDF is in a nice order as well.
fields.summary: Allow for re-ordering of pages in a space

fields.description:
Currently, there are 3 decorators defined in the Look and Feel Settings: Main, Popup and Printable.

They are customizable and I gather that in 1.0rc1 they will be customizable per space.

What I would like is the ability to add new decorators to those three.  They would be defined globally and chosen per space.  Perhaps I could have n decorators and in each space I could specify "use this one for Main, this one for Popups and this one for Printable".  Or course, there would be a global default as well.
fields.summary: Adding custom decorators

fields.description:
Confluence uses cookies for authentication -- well and good.  But, I really really find it useful to track wikis using news aggregators via a wiki's RSS feed(s).  Did I mention *really* useful.

There are plenty of news aggregators out there that can handle http authentication, either in the url or not.  My favorite (sharpreader) does, newsgator, etc.

None that I know of are equiped to use cookies at all.  While I think it wouldn't be hard to add something like this (esp. for aggregators that integrate the browser somehow), they have argued that it doesn't make sense for RSS feeds to use cookie authentication.  That makes sense -- there is no need to remember session/state information with an RSS feed, which is the point of cookies in my understanding.

Can JIRA be tailored to use HTTP authentication for for the RSS feeds, when those feeds originate from spaces that require authentication?  I realize that spaces can be tailored so that non-authenticated users can read them, but we just can't go that way, I'm told.
fields.summary: Use HTTP authentication for RSS feeds

fields.description: If you just change the parent page in the "Edit page" screen, the change is not saved. You have to also change the content of the page, which seems a little unnecessary...
fields.summary: Changing parent page doesn't work

fields.description: Implement a remote XML-RPC based API along the lines of http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Confluence%2BXML-RPC%2BAPI%2BSpec
fields.summary: Remote XML-RPC API

fields.description: When renaming a page it truncalates the first letter of the new link and capitalizes all the letters in it. Making the link point to nothing.
fields.summary: When renaming a page name truncalates first letter of new link

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Broken%2BNoformat%252C%2Blinks%252C%2Band%2Btables

I have a table with a set of psuedo URL that I do not want rendered as linkable content.

Right now the hack is to run the url against the table definition.

It would be nice to have a way to say, nolink, so the link could be inside a paragraph.

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to define an anchor in a page, e.g. "{anchor:foo}", and link to it from within the page without qualifying the link with the page title.  I.e. the link [#foo] doesn't work, whereas [PageTitle#foo] does (if "PageTitle" is the actual title of the page).
The current rendering of 
[Introduction|Confluence API Spec#introduction] rendered as 
Introduction#introduction
[link|#test] link#test

fields.summary: exception when removing page

fields.description:
The comment section of a page is displayed if the link "Add Comment" or the link "X comments" (where X is the current number of comments to the page) at the bottom of the page is clicked.  This is fine.  Unfortunately this is not remembered on a per page basis.  If subsequently another page is viewed, its comments section is also displayed.  And worse, the input focus of the browser is in the "Add Comment" text area, so the browser automatically scrolls down to the bottom of the page when it's loaded.  To get rid of this behaviour one has to click "Cancel" in the comments section.  After this comments are again not displayed on any subsequently loaded pages.

Ideally this would be remembered on a per page basis.  Per default the section should be hidden, but if it was displayed before for a certain page it should remain visible on subsequent visits until explicitly hidden again.

Alternatively the comments section could remain hidden on all page loads until explicitly requested to be shown.  But hidden again on subsequent visits.

But above all, the "Add Comment" text area should *only* reveive input focus when explicitly requested.
fields.summary: Display of comment section remembered by page

fields.description:
First, I think you could use a Blog entry in the Components list up there.


I'm glad to see a blogging tool in 1.0b4.  To me a blog is usually person-centric.  So there are two features I'd really like to see:

1) a New Blog Entry function for a user's profile.  Basically so I can add a blog entry that isn't attached to a Space and is just for me.

2) a "Recent Blog Entries" list on a user's profile page, just like "Recently Edited Pages".  Or if not, at least include blog entries in the Recently Edited Pages list.  They're not there now.

fields.description:
I think I saw a bug today, but I haven't had time to reproduce it.

I was moving a page from the DOCPRIV space to the DOC space (Release notes for b4) and the page being moved contained a link to another page in the DOCPRIV space. After moving, the link was broken (it was trying to point to DOC:Link not DOCPRIV:Link). 

Maybe moving a page doesn't update the links internal to a page to point back to the old space?
fields.summary: Moving page doesn't update internal links

fields.description:
Confluence gets confused when latin characters (non-ascii in general?) are used in the page title.

Specifically:

 - creating a new page with a latin character in the title, e.g. "Stéphane", only works partially.  After "Add" has been clicked an error page is displayed with the message "The following error(s) occurred: The page specified does not exist."  The URL in the browser location field reads "/St%25E9phane" in the last segment.  But as can be seen in the space summary the page was indeed created (with the correct name).
 - linking to a page with latin characters doesn't work.  When a link, e.g. [Stéphane], is added to a page, it displays correctly but clicking on it yields the same result as when the page was first created (error description of previous bullet).

Further observations:

 - After a page with a latin character in the title has been created it is displayed in the "Recently Updated Pages" of the space summary.  Clicking on the page link there works, as the link is of the form "/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=54".
 - Entering an URL like "/display/PAR/Stéphane" (where PAR is the space key) takes me to the created page.
fields.summary: cannot use latin characters in page title

fields.description: The release notes mention the new anchor mechanism as being composed of an {anchor} macro and a #-sign for anchor linking in the Wiki syntax.  The documentation, however, does not document the syntax for the {anchor} macro.
fields.summary: documentation for {anchor} macro missing

fields.description: ... not the space summary page.
fields.summary: Home link should take users to the home page

fields.description:
Here's what I did: Open a page, edit, preview, press re-edit, preview, re-edit (continue for a while). When I then pressed update, Confluence told me someone else had edited the page in the meantime after I started editing and that my changes would overwrite some of the content. I copied my new content into safety and cancelled, opened the page for editing againg and then saving worked fine.

Looking at the page history, the page was last edited in Jan 22nd which is days ago so nobody else was actually editing the content. ( http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?spaceKey=DISC&title=Importing+and+Exporting )

So I guess there's something odd with the temporary persistence of previewed documents which is causing the "check versioning upon save" to compare the documents previewed by the user as opposed to the latest saved version, hence breaking the comparison operation.
fields.summary: Previewing multiple times while editing confuses the versioning system

fields.description:
We need to separate the renderer into it's own component, so that we can use it from JIRA. 

We'll need to decide which macros and filters are Confluence specific (leaving them in Confluence) and which aren't (putting them into 'renderer' component).

Also the current ConfluenceRenderEngine can be improved I think to make more of the functionality portable to JIRA, leaving only the Conf specific stuff in Confluence.

fields.description:
Ok, I'm not really certain that it fails with all changes of database.  But I do know that I had a problem importing into PostgresQL what I exported from HSQL.  I don't think it's a problem with communicating to PostgresQL because it generates all the tables.

Here's a high-level log:

set up with HSQL
enter data
export
shutdown
set up again with HSQL
import fine
set up again with PostgreSQL
import hangs


Maybe this issue is really about a problem with my Confluence talking to my PostgresQL database.  If so then I think there's an issue here with verifying the connection immediately after it's configured.
fields.summary: Import fails if export is from different database

fields.description: I think the rendered form of [mailto:david.mankin@company.com] should be _david@company.com_ not _mailto:david@company.com_.  As it stands now, I have to type [david.mankin@company.com|mailto:david.mankin@company.com] which makes for a very wide entry in a table cell (& more likely to make typos).
fields.summary: mailto links should look better

fields.description:
Textile supports the following markup:

  lazy writing -- and theft

to render:

  writing—and theft

(taken from http://www.textism.com/tools/textile/index.html)

Confluence just leaves it as two dashes.  And if I type this:

  writing -- and theft --

Confluence renders that as:

  writing <del class="deleted">- and theft -</del>


I think that in both cases the "--" should render as an emdash.
fields.summary: Support emdash like Textile
